body_html:
The solution is simple: when the tensorflow environment is activated, i.e. after running source activate tensorflow, ipython needs to get installed (again? specifically for that environment?) using conda install ipython. After this, importing tensorflow in ipython works just fine.

This seems to be a conda-specific procedure or requirement (I do not know that much about conda and simply tried if that would help).

The solution is simple: when the tensorflow environment is activated, i.e. after running source activate tensorflow, ipython needs to get installed (again? specifically for that environment?) using conda install ipython. After this, importing tensorflow in ipython works just fine.
This seems to be a conda-specific procedure or requirement (I do not know that much about conda and simply tried if that would help).
body:
The solution is simple: when the tensorflow environment is activated, i.e. after running `source activate tensorflow`, ipython needs to get installed (again? specifically for that environment?) using `conda install ipython`. After this, importing tensorflow in ipython works just fine. 

This seems to be a conda-specific procedure or requirement (I do not know that much about conda and simply tried if that would help).
